abstract: Canadian Prime Min Stephen Harper asks Parliament to broaden mission against Islamic State militants to include airstrikes on Syrian targets and to lengthen military involvement for another year; opposition lawmakers do not support extension citing Harper did not entirely reveal function of ground troops in 2014.
lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Stephen Harper asked Parliament on Tuesday to extend and expand the country’s military mission against Islamic State militants by another year.

headline.main: Canada: Role Against ISIS to Grow
headline.print_headline: The Americas; Canada: Role Against ISIS to Grow

snippet: Prime Minister Stephen Harper asked Parliament on Tuesday to extend and expand the country’s military mission against Islamic State militants by another year.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
